alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 1:28AM MST until December 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Southwest Wyoming. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 AM MST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Wyoming Department of Transportation, visit http://www.wyoroad.info or dial 511.
